verses.translation: O Zakariya, indeed We give you good tidings of a boy whose name will be Yahya. We have not assigned to any before [this] name.

verses.arabic: قَالَ رَبِّ أَنَّىٰ يَكُونُ لِي غُلَٰمٞ وَكَانَتِ ٱمۡرَأَتِي عَاقِرٗا وَقَدۡ بَلَغۡتُ مِنَ ٱلۡكِبَرِ عِتِيّٗا
verses.transliteration: Qaala Rabbi annaa yakoonu lee ghulaamunw wa kaanatim ra'atee 'aaqiranw wa qad balaghtu minal kibari 'itiyyaa
verses.translation: He said, 'My Lord, how will I have a boy when my wife has been barren and I have reached extreme old age?'

verses.arabic: قَالَ كَذَٰلِكَ قَالَ رَبُّكَ هُوَ عَلَيَّ هَيِّنٞ وَقَدۡ خَلَقۡتُكَ مِن قَبۡلُ وَلَمۡ تَكُ شَيۡـٔٗا
verses.transliteration: Qaala kazaalika qaala Rabbuka huwa 'alaiya haiyinunw wa qad khalaqtuka min qablu wa lam taku shai'aa
verses.translation: He said, 'Thus [it will be]; your Lord says, "It is easy for Me, for I created you before, while you were nothing."'

hadiths.text: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Zakariya was a carpenter (who earned his livelihood through his own hands).'

historicalNotes: Zakariya (AS) is mentioned 7 times in the Quran. He lived during the period of Roman rule over Palestine, serving as a priest in the Second Temple in Jerusalem. He was the guardian of Maryam (Mary) and the father of Yahya (John the Baptist). According to some traditions, he was martyred by being sawed in two while hiding inside a tree. His story demonstrates that Allah answers prayers according to His wisdom, even when what is asked for seems impossible by worldly standards.

summary: Prophet Yahya (AS), known as John the Baptist, was the miraculous son of the elderly Zakariya. He was given wisdom as a child, lived an ascetic life of piety, and called people to repentance. He confirmed the coming of Isa (AS) and is described in the Quran as noble, chaste, and a prophet from among the righteous.
keyLessons: Purity of heart and chastity are noble traits
Youth is no barrier to wisdom and prophethood
Calling to repentance is a prophetic duty
Kindness to parents is connected to righteousness
Living simply and focusing on the eternal is praiseworthy

sections.title: The Miraculous Birth
sections.content: Yahya was born to Zakariya and his wife in their extreme old age - a miracle that demonstrated Allah's power. His name was chosen by Allah Himself, and it was a name never given to anyone before him. From his earliest years, he was granted wisdom and understanding beyond his age. He grew up devoted to Allah, living a life of piety and simplicity.

verses.arabic: يَٰيَحۡيَىٰ خُذِ ٱلۡكِتَٰبَ بِقُوَّةٖۖ وَءَاتَيۡنَٰهُ ٱلۡحُكۡمَ صَبِيّٗا
verses.transliteration: Yaa Yahyaa khuzil Kitaaba biquwwah; wa aatainaahul hukma sabiyyaa
verses.translation: O Yahya, take the Scripture with determination. And We gave him judgment [while yet] a boy.

verses.arabic: فَنَادَتۡهُ ٱلۡمَلَٰٓئِكَةُ وَهُوَ قَآئِمٞ يُصَلِّي فِي ٱلۡمِحۡرَابِ أَنَّ ٱللَّهَ يُبَشِّرُكَ بِيَحۡيَىٰ مُصَدِّقٗا بِكَلِمَةٖ مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ وَسَيِّدٗا وَحَصُورٗا وَنَبِيّٗا مِّنَ ٱلصَّٰلِحِينَ
verses.transliteration: Fanaadat hul malaaa'ikatu wa huwa qaaa'imuny yusallee fil mihraabi annal laaha yubashshiruka bi Yahyaa musaddiqam bi Kalimatim minal laahi wa saiyidanw wa hasooranw wa Nabiyyam minas saaliheen
verses.translation: So the angels called him while he was standing in prayer in the chamber, 'Indeed, Allah gives you good tidings of Yahya, confirming a word from Allah and [who will be] noble, chaste, and a prophet from among the righteous.'

sections.title: Noble Character and Asceticism
sections.content: Yahya lived a life of extreme piety and simplicity. He abstained from worldly pleasures, wore coarse clothing, and subsisted on simple food. He was known for his chastity (hasur) - controlling his desires completely. He was compassionate, tender-hearted, and dutiful to his parents. He never showed arrogance or disobedience. These qualities made him beloved to Allah and honored among people.

verses.arabic: وَحَنَانٗا مِّن لَّدُنَّا وَزَكَوٰةٗۖ وَكَانَ تَقِيّٗا
verses.transliteration: Wa hanaanan mil ladunnaa wa zakaah; wa kaana taqiyyaa
verses.translation: And [gave him] affection from Us and purity, and he was fearing of Allah.

verses.arabic: وَبَرّٗا بِوَٰلِدَيۡهِ وَلَمۡ يَكُن جَبَّارًا عَصِيّٗا
verses.transliteration: Wa barram biwaalidaihi wa lam yakun jabbaaran 'asiyyaa
verses.translation: And dutiful to his parents, and he was not a disobedient tyrant.

hadiths.text: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'There is no one among the sons of Adam who has not sinned or was about to sin, except Yahya ibn Zakariya.'

sections.title: Confirming the Word
sections.content: Yahya's mission was to call people to repentance and prepare them for the coming of Isa (AS). The Quran describes him as 'confirming a Word from Allah' - referring to Isa, who is called a Word from Allah. Yahya recognized Isa's prophethood and confirmed his message. He baptized people as a symbol of spiritual purification and called them to turn back to Allah with sincere hearts.

verses.arabic: أَنَّ ٱللَّهَ يُبَشِّرُكَ بِيَحۡيَىٰ مُصَدِّقٗا بِكَلِمَةٖ مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ
verses.transliteration: Annal laaha yubashshiruka bi Yahyaa musaddiqam bi Kalimatim minal laah
verses.translation: Indeed, Allah gives you good tidings of Yahya, confirming a word from Allah.

sections.title: Peace Upon Yahya
sections.content: Allah blessed Yahya with peace on three critical occasions: the day he was born, the day he would die, and the day he would be raised alive. According to historical accounts, Yahya was martyred by the ruler of his time. Despite his tragic end at the hands of the unjust, he remains honored in the sight of Allah as one of the most righteous of prophets.

verses.arabic: وَسَلَٰمٌ عَلَيۡهِ يَوۡمَ وُلِدَ وَيَوۡمَ يَمُوتُ وَيَوۡمَ يُبۡعَثُ حَيّٗا
verses.transliteration: Wa salaamun 'alaihi yawma wulida wa yawma yamootu wa yawma yub'asu haiyaa
verses.translation: And peace be upon him the day he was born and the day he dies and the day he is raised alive.

hadiths.text: The Prophet (ﷺ) said about his journey during the Isra (Night Journey): 'Then I was taken up to the second heaven, and there I found Yahya and Isa, who are cousins.'

historicalNotes: Yahya (AS) is mentioned 5 times in the Quran. He is known as John the Baptist in Christian tradition. He lived during the reign of Herod Antipas and was executed for speaking out against the king's unlawful marriage. His emphasis on repentance and purification prepared the way for the mission of Isa (AS). He and Isa were cousins, as their mothers (Elizabeth and Maryam) were related. During the Prophet Muhammad's Night Journey, he met Yahya and Isa together in the second heaven.

summary: Prophet Isa (AS), known as Jesus, was born miraculously to the virgin Maryam without a father. He is one of the five greatest prophets (Ulul 'Azm), performed extraordinary miracles by Allah's permission, and was raised alive to the heavens. Muslims believe he will return before the Day of Judgment. He is called the Messiah (Al-Masih) and a Word from Allah.
keyLessons: Allah's power transcends natural laws
True honor comes from being a servant of Allah
Miracles are from Allah, not from the prophet himself
Monotheism is the consistent message of all prophets
This world is temporary; the Hereafter is eternal

sections.title: The Miraculous Conception
sections.content: Maryam, a virgin devoted to worship, was visited by the angel Jibril who appeared in human form. He announced that Allah would grant her a son, a sign for humanity. She was amazed, asking how she could have a child when no man had touched her. Jibril explained that for Allah, creating without normal means is easy - He merely says 'Be' and it is. She conceived Isa by Allah's command, a miracle paralleling Adam's creation without parents.

verses.arabic: فَأَرۡسَلۡنَآ إِلَيۡهَا رُوحَنَا فَتَمَثَّلَ لَهَا بَشَرٗا سَوِيّٗا
verses.transliteration: Fa arsalnaaa ilaihaa roohanaa fatamasssala lahaa basharan sawiyyaa
verses.translation: Then We sent to her Our Spirit [Jibril], and he represented himself to her as a well-proportioned man.

verses.arabic: قَالَتۡ أَنَّىٰ يَكُونُ لِي غُلَٰمٞ وَلَمۡ يَمۡسَسۡنِي بَشَرٞ وَلَمۡ أَكُ بَغِيّٗا
verses.transliteration: Qaalat annaa yakoonu lee ghulaamunw wa lam yamsasnee basharunw wa lam aku baghiyyaa
verses.translation: She said, 'How can I have a boy while no man has touched me and I have not been unchaste?'

verses.arabic: إِنَّ مَثَلَ عِيسَىٰ عِندَ ٱللَّهِ كَمَثَلِ ءَادَمَۖ خَلَقَهُۥ مِن تُرَابٖ ثُمَّ قَالَ لَهُۥ كُن فَيَكُونُ
verses.transliteration: Inna masala 'Eesaa 'indal laahi kamasali Aadama khalaqahoo min turaabin summa qaala lahoo kun fayakoon
verses.translation: Indeed, the example of Isa to Allah is like that of Adam. He created him from dust; then He said to him, 'Be,' and he was.

sections.title: Speaking in the Cradle
sections.content: When Maryam returned to her people with the baby Isa, they accused her of immorality. Allah commanded her to fast from speech and point to the child. Then, by Allah's miracle, the infant Isa spoke from the cradle, declaring himself a servant of Allah, a prophet who was given the Scripture, and one who was blessed wherever he would be. He proclaimed his duty to pray and give charity as long as he lived.

verses.arabic: قَالَ إِنِّي عَبۡدُ ٱللَّهِ ءَاتَىٰنِيَ ٱلۡكِتَٰبَ وَجَعَلَنِي نَبِيّٗا
verses.transliteration: Qaala innee 'abdullaahi aataaniyal Kitaaba wa ja'alanee Nabiyyaa
verses.translation: He said, 'Indeed, I am the servant of Allah. He has given me the Scripture and made me a prophet.'

verses.arabic: وَجَعَلَنِي مُبَارَكًا أَيۡنَ مَا كُنتُ وَأَوۡصَٰنِي بِٱلصَّلَوٰةِ وَٱلزَّكَوٰةِ مَا دُمۡتُ حَيّٗا
verses.transliteration: Wa ja'alanee mubaarakan aina maa kuntu wa awsaanee bis Salaati waz Zakaati maa dumtu haiyaa
verses.translation: And He has made me blessed wherever I am and has enjoined upon me prayer and zakah as long as I remain alive.

verses.arabic: إِذۡ قَالَ ٱللَّهُ يَٰعِيسَى ٱبۡنَ مَرۡيَمَ ٱذۡكُرۡ نِعۡمَتِي عَلَيۡكَ وَعَلَىٰ وَٰلِدَتِكَ إِذۡ أَيَّدتُّكَ بِرُوحِ ٱلۡقُدُسِ تُكَلِّمُ ٱلنَّاسَ فِي ٱلۡمَهۡدِ وَكَهۡلٗا
verses.transliteration: Iz qaalal laahu yaa 'Eesab na Maryamaz kur ni'matee 'alaika wa 'alaa waalidatika iz aiyadtuka bi Roohil Qudusi tukalimun naasa fil mahdi wa kahlaa
verses.translation: When Allah will say, 'O Isa, Son of Maryam, remember My favor upon you and upon your mother when I supported you with the Pure Spirit [Jibril] and you spoke to the people in the cradle and in maturity.'

sections.title: The Miracles of Isa
sections.content: Allah granted Isa extraordinary miracles to prove his prophethood. He healed the blind and the leper, raised the dead by Allah's permission, and fashioned birds from clay that came alive when he breathed into them. He informed people of what they had eaten and stored in their homes. All these miracles were by Allah's permission, demonstrating that the power belonged to Allah alone, not to Isa himself.

verses.arabic: وَرَسُولًا إِلَىٰ بَنِيٓ إِسۡرَٰٓءِيلَ أَنِّي قَدۡ جِئۡتُكُم بِـَٔايَةٖ مِّن رَّبِّكُمۡ أَنِّيٓ أَخۡلُقُ لَكُم مِّنَ ٱلطِّينِ كَهَيۡـَٔةِ ٱلطَّيۡرِ فَأَنفُخُ فِيهِ فَيَكُونُ طَيۡرَۢا بِإِذۡنِ ٱللَّهِۖ وَأُبۡرِئُ ٱلۡأَكۡمَهَ وَٱلۡأَبۡرَصَ وَأُحۡيِ ٱلۡمَوۡتَىٰ بِإِذۡنِ ٱللَّهِ
verses.transliteration: Wa Rasoolan ilaa Baneee Israaa'eela annee qad ji'tukum bi Aayatim mir Rabbikum anneee akhluqu lakum minat teeni kahai 'atit tairi fa anfukhu feehi fayakoonu tairam bi iznil laah; wa ubri'ul akmaha wal abrasa wa uhyil mawtaa bi iznil laah
verses.translation: And [make him] a messenger to the Children of Israel, [who will say], 'Indeed I have come to you with a sign from your Lord in that I design for you from clay [that which is] like the form of a bird, then I breathe into it and it becomes a bird by permission of Allah. And I cure the blind and the leper, and I give life to the dead - by permission of Allah.'

sections.title: The Message of Monotheism
sections.content: Isa's message was pure monotheism - worship Allah alone with no partners. He came to confirm the Torah that came before him and to make lawful some things that had been forbidden. He brought the Injeel (Gospel) as guidance and light. He never claimed divinity for himself; rather, he consistently pointed to Allah as his Lord and the Lord of all. He called his followers to worship Allah, the One True God.

verses.arabic: لَقَدۡ كَفَرَ ٱلَّذِينَ قَالُوٓاْ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ هُوَ ٱلۡمَسِيحُ ٱبۡنُ مَرۡيَمَۖ وَقَالَ ٱلۡمَسِيحُ يَٰبَنِيٓ إِسۡرَٰٓءِيلَ ٱعۡبُدُواْ ٱللَّهَ رَبِّي وَرَبَّكُمۡ
verses.transliteration: Laqad kafaral lazeena qaalooo innal laaha Huwal Maseehub nu Maryam; wa qaalal Maseehu yaa Baneee Israaa'eela' budul laaha Rabbee wa Rabbakum
verses.translation: They have certainly disbelieved who say, 'Allah is the Messiah, the son of Maryam.' But the Messiah said, 'O Children of Israel, worship Allah, my Lord and your Lord.'

verses.arabic: وَإِذۡ قَالَ ٱللَّهُ يَٰعِيسَى ٱبۡنَ مَرۡيَمَ ءَأَنتَ قُلۡتَ لِلنَّاسِ ٱتَّخِذُونِي وَأُمِّيَ إِلَٰهَيۡنِ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِۖ قَالَ سُبۡحَٰنَكَ مَا يَكُونُ لِيٓ أَنۡ أَقُولَ مَا لَيۡسَ لِي بِحَقٍّ
verses.transliteration: Wa iz qaalal laahu yaa 'Eesab na Maryama 'a-anta qulta linnaasit takhizoonee wa ummiya ilaahaini min doonil laah; qaala Subhaanaka maa yakoonu leee an aqoola maa laisa lee bihaqq
verses.translation: And [beware the Day] when Allah will say, 'O Isa, Son of Maryam, did you say to the people, "Take me and my mother as deities besides Allah?"' He will say, 'Exalted are You! It was not for me to say that to which I have no right.'

sections.title: Raised to the Heavens
sections.content: When the enemies of Isa plotted to kill him, Allah protected him by raising him alive to the heavens. The Quran clearly states that they did not kill him nor crucify him, but it was made to appear so to them. Isa was raised to Allah, and he remains alive in the heavens. Muslims believe he will return before the Day of Judgment, descend to earth, and complete his mission.

verses.arabic: وَقَوۡلِهِمۡ إِنَّا قَتَلۡنَا ٱلۡمَسِيحَ عِيسَى ٱبۡنَ مَرۡيَمَ رَسُولَ ٱللَّهِ وَمَا قَتَلُوهُ وَمَا صَلَبُوهُ وَلَٰكِن شُبِّهَ لَهُمۡ
verses.transliteration: Wa qawlihim innaa qatalnal Maseeha 'Eesab na Maryama Rasoolal laahi wa maa qataloohu wa maa salaboohu wa laakin shubbiha lahum
verses.translation: And [for] their saying, 'Indeed, we have killed the Messiah, Isa, the son of Maryam, the messenger of Allah.' And they did not kill him, nor did they crucify him; but [another] was made to resemble him to them.

verses.arabic: بَل رَّفَعَهُ ٱللَّهُ إِلَيۡهِۚ وَكَانَ ٱللَّهُ عَزِيزًا حَكِيمٗا
verses.transliteration: Bar rafa'ahul laahu ilayh; wa kaanal laahu 'Azeezan Hakeemaa
verses.translation: Rather, Allah raised him to Himself. And ever is Allah Exalted in Might and Wise.

verses.arabic: إِذۡ قَالَ ٱللَّهُ يَٰعِيسَىٰٓ إِنِّي مُتَوَفِّيكَ وَرَافِعُكَ إِلَيَّ وَمُطَهِّرُكَ مِنَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ
verses.transliteration: Iz qaalal laahu yaa 'Eesaaa innee mutawaffeeka wa raafi'uka ilaiya wa mutahhiruka minal lazeena kafaroo
verses.translation: When Allah said, 'O Isa, indeed I will take you and raise you to Myself and purify you from those who disbelieve.'

hadiths.text: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'By Him in Whose Hands my soul is, the son of Maryam (Isa) will soon descend amongst you as a just judge. He will break the cross, kill the pigs, and abolish the Jizyah (tax). Wealth will be in such abundance that nobody will accept it.'

sections.title: The Second Coming
sections.content: Muslims believe that Isa will return before the Day of Judgment. He will descend in Damascus, pray behind the Muslim leader, defeat the false Messiah (Dajjal), and establish justice on earth. He will live as a follower of the final law brought by Muhammad (ﷺ), marry, have children, and eventually die a natural death. His return is one of the major signs of the Hour.

verses.arabic: وَإِنَّهُۥ لَعِلۡمٞ لِّلسَّاعَةِ فَلَا تَمۡتَرُنَّ بِهَا وَٱتَّبِعُونِۚ هَٰذَا صِرَٰطٞ مُّسۡتَقِيمٞ
verses.transliteration: Wa innahoo la'ilmul lis Saa'ati falaa tamtarunna bihaa wattabi'oon; haazaa Siraatum Mustaqeem
verses.translation: And indeed, Isa will be [a sign for] knowledge of the Hour, so be not in doubt of it, and follow Me. This is a straight path.

hadiths.text: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Isa son of Maryam will descend at the white minaret on the eastern side of Damascus, wearing two garments lightly dyed with saffron, placing his hands on the wings of two angels.'

historicalNotes: Isa (AS) is mentioned by name 25 times in the Quran and is referred to as 'the Messiah' (Al-Masih) 11 times. He is one of the five Ulul 'Azm (Prophets of Great Resolve). His mother Maryam is the only woman mentioned by name in the Quran, and Surah 19 is named after her. He is called 'a Word from Allah' and 'a Spirit from Him.' Muslims honor him as one of the greatest prophets while rejecting claims of his divinity. His virgin birth, miracles, and raising to the heavens are all affirmed in Islam.

summary: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) is the final messenger of Allah, sent as a mercy to all worlds. He received the Quran over 23 years and established Islam as the complete way of life. His life, character, and teachings serve as the perfect example for humanity. He is the seal of the prophets, after whom no prophet will come.
keyLessons: Islam is the completion of all previous revelations
The Quran is Allah's final, preserved message to humanity
The Prophet's character (Sunnah) is the practical guide for life
Mercy, justice, and compassion are central to Islam
Steadfastness in faith leads to ultimate success

sections.title: Birth and Early Life
sections.content: Muhammad (ﷺ) was born in Makkah in the Year of the Elephant (570 CE) into the noble tribe of Quraysh. His father Abdullah died before his birth, and his mother Aminah passed away when he was six. He was raised first by his grandfather Abdul Muttalib and then by his uncle Abu Talib. Even before prophethood, he was known as Al-Amin (the Trustworthy) and As-Sadiq (the Truthful) for his impeccable character.

verses.arabic: أَلَمۡ يَجِدۡكَ يَتِيمٗا فَـَٔاوَىٰ
verses.transliteration: Alam yajidka yateeman fa aawaa
verses.translation: Did He not find you an orphan and give [you] refuge?

verses.arabic: وَوَجَدَكَ ضَآلّٗا فَهَدَىٰ
verses.transliteration: Wa wajadaka daallan fahadaa
verses.translation: And He found you lost and guided [you].

verses.arabic: وَرَفَعۡنَا لَكَ ذِكۡرَكَ
verses.transliteration: Wa rafa'naa laka zikrak
verses.translation: And raised high for you your repute.

sections.title: The First Revelation
sections.content: At age 40, while meditating in the Cave of Hira during the month of Ramadan, Muhammad (ﷺ) received his first revelation through the angel Jibril. The command was 'Iqra' (Read/Recite). This marked the beginning of prophethood and the gradual revelation of the Quran over the next 23 years. Initially, the Prophet was overwhelmed, but his wife Khadijah and her cousin Waraqah confirmed that he had been chosen as a prophet.

verses.arabic: ٱقۡرَأۡ بِٱسۡمِ رَبِّكَ ٱلَّذِي خَلَقَ
verses.transliteration: Iqra bismi Rabbikal lazee khalaq
verses.translation: Recite in the name of your Lord who created.

verses.arabic: خَلَقَ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنَ مِنۡ عَلَقٍ
verses.transliteration: Khalaqal insaana min 'alaq
verses.translation: Created man from a clinging substance.

verses.arabic: ٱقۡرَأۡ وَرَبُّكَ ٱلۡأَكۡرَمُ
verses.transliteration: Iqra wa Rabbukal Akram
verses.translation: Recite, and your Lord is the most Generous.

hadiths.text: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'The angel caught me and pressed me so hard that I could not bear it any more. He then released me and said: "Read!" I replied: "I do not know how to read." He pressed me three times until he said: "Read in the name of your Lord who created..."'

sections.title: The Makkan Period
sections.content: For 13 years in Makkah, the Prophet (ﷺ) called people to worship Allah alone. He faced severe persecution, mockery, and boycott from the Quraysh. Key companions like Abu Bakr, Khadijah, Ali, and Bilal accepted Islam early. The Prophet lost his beloved wife Khadijah and uncle Abu Talib in the 'Year of Sorrow.' He experienced the Night Journey (Isra) and Ascension (Mi'raj), during which he met previous prophets and received the command for five daily prayers.

verses.arabic: سُبۡحَٰنَ ٱلَّذِيٓ أَسۡرَىٰ بِعَبۡدِهِۦ لَيۡلٗا مِّنَ ٱلۡمَسۡجِدِ ٱلۡحَرَامِ إِلَى ٱلۡمَسۡجِدِ ٱلۡأَقۡصَا ٱلَّذِي بَٰرَكۡنَا حَوۡلَهُۥ لِنُرِيَهُۥ مِنۡ ءَايَٰتِنَآۚ إِنَّهُۥ هُوَ ٱلسَّمِيعُ ٱلۡبَصِيرُ
verses.transliteration: Subhaanal lazeee asraa bi'abdihee lailam minal Masjidil Haraami ilal Masjidil Aqsal lazee baaraknaa hawlahoo linuriyahoo min Aayaatinaa; innahoo Huwas Samee'ul Baseer
verses.translation: Exalted is He who took His Servant by night from al-Masjid al-Haram to al-Masjid al-Aqsa, whose surroundings We have blessed, to show him of Our signs. Indeed, He is the Hearing, the Seeing.

hadiths.text: The Prophet (ﷺ) described his Night Journey: 'I was brought al-Buraq... I mounted it and came to Jerusalem. There I tied it to the ring used by the prophets. I entered the mosque, prayed two rak'ahs, and then I was taken up to heaven...'

sections.title: The Madinan Period
sections.content: The Prophet (ﷺ) migrated to Madinah in 622 CE (the Hijrah), establishing the first Islamic state. He built the Prophet's Mosque, united the Ansar (helpers) and Muhajirin (emigrants), and established the Constitution of Madinah. The Muslims faced battles at Badr, Uhud, and the Trench. The Treaty of Hudaybiyyah and the conquest of Makkah followed. In his final years, Islam spread throughout Arabia, and he performed the Farewell Pilgrimage.

verses.arabic: إِلَّا تَنصُرُوهُ فَقَدۡ نَصَرَهُ ٱللَّهُ إِذۡ أَخۡرَجَهُ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ ثَانِيَ ٱثۡنَيۡنِ إِذۡ هُمَا فِي ٱلۡغَارِ إِذۡ يَقُولُ لِصَٰحِبِهِۦ لَا تَحۡزَنۡ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ مَعَنَاۖ
verses.transliteration: Illaa tansuroohu faqad nasarahul laahu iz akhrajahul lazeena kafaroo saaniyas naini iz humaa fil ghaari iz yaqoolu lisaahibihee laa tahzan innal laaha ma'anaa
verses.translation: If you do not aid the Prophet - Allah has already aided him when those who disbelieved had driven him out [of Makkah] as one of two, when they were in the cave and he said to his companion, 'Do not grieve; indeed Allah is with us.'

verses.arabic: إِذَا جَآءَ نَصۡرُ ٱللَّهِ وَٱلۡفَتۡحُ
verses.transliteration: Izaa jaaa'a nasrul laahi walfath
verses.translation: When the victory of Allah has come and the conquest.

sections.title: The Perfect Example
sections.content: The Prophet (ﷺ) is described in the Quran as being of 'exalted character.' He was the most generous, the bravest, the most just, and the most merciful of people. He was humble, forgiving, and always accessible to his companions. He mended his own clothes, helped with household chores, and treated all people with dignity. His character was the living embodiment of the Quran, and Allah commanded believers to follow his example.

verses.arabic: وَإِنَّكَ لَعَلَىٰ خُلُقٍ عَظِيمٖ
verses.transliteration: Wa innaka la'alaa khuluqin 'azeem
verses.translation: And indeed, you are of a great moral character.

verses.arabic: لَّقَدۡ كَانَ لَكُمۡ فِي رَسُولِ ٱللَّهِ أُسۡوَةٌ حَسَنَةٞ لِّمَن كَانَ يَرۡجُواْ ٱللَّهَ وَٱلۡيَوۡمَ ٱلۡأٓخِرَ وَذَكَرَ ٱللَّهَ كَثِيرٗا
verses.transliteration: Laqad kaana lakum fee Rasoolil laahi uswatun hasanatul liman kaana yarjul laaha wal Yawmal Aakhira wa zakaral laaha kaseeraa
verses.translation: There has certainly been for you in the Messenger of Allah an excellent pattern for anyone whose hope is in Allah and the Last Day and [who] remembers Allah often.

verses.arabic: وَمَآ أَرۡسَلۡنَٰكَ إِلَّا رَحۡمَةٗ لِّلۡعَٰلَمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa maaa arsalnaaka illaa rahmatal lil'aalameen
verses.translation: And We have not sent you, [O Muhammad], except as a mercy to the worlds.

hadiths.text: When Aisha was asked about the character of the Prophet (ﷺ), she replied: 'His character was the Quran.'

sections.title: The Seal of Prophets
sections.content: Muhammad (ﷺ) is the final prophet and messenger, after whom no prophet will come. His message is universal, meant for all of humanity until the Day of Judgment. The Quran, revealed to him, is preserved exactly as it was revealed and will remain so forever. His prophethood confirmed all previous prophets while completing and perfecting the divine message. Every Muslim is required to believe in him and follow his guidance.

verses.arabic: مَّا كَانَ مُحَمَّدٌ أَبَآ أَحَدٖ مِّن رِّجَالِكُمۡ وَلَٰكِن رَّسُولَ ٱللَّهِ وَخَاتَمَ ٱلنَّبِيِّـۧنَۗ وَكَانَ ٱللَّهُ بِكُلِّ شَيۡءٍ عَلِيمٗا
verses.transliteration: Maa kaana Muhammadun abaaa ahadim mir rijaalikum wa laakir Rasoolal laahi wa Khaataman Nabiyyeen; wa kaanal laahu bikulli shai'in 'Aleemaa
verses.translation: Muhammad is not the father of [any] one of your men, but [he is] the Messenger of Allah and seal [last] of the prophets. And ever is Allah, of all things, Knowing.

verses.arabic: وَمَآ أَرۡسَلۡنَٰكَ إِلَّا كَآفَّةٗ لِّلنَّاسِ بَشِيرٗا وَنَذِيرٗا وَلَٰكِنَّ أَكۡثَرَ ٱلنَّاسِ لَا يَعۡلَمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa maaa arsalnaaka illaa kaaffatal linnaasi basheeranw wa nazeeranw wa laakinna aksaran naasi laa ya'lamoon
verses.translation: And We have not sent you except comprehensively to mankind as a bringer of good tidings and a warner. But most of the people do not know.

hadiths.text: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'My similitude in comparison with the other prophets is that of a man who has built a house nicely and beautifully, except for a place of one brick in a corner. The people go about it and wonder at its beauty, but say: "If only this brick be put in its place!" So I am that brick, and I am the last of the Prophets.'

historicalNotes: Muhammad (ﷺ) is mentioned by name 4 times in the Quran and referred to as 'the Prophet' or 'the Messenger' in many other places. He is the most documented figure in human history, with his sayings (hadith), actions, and life events preserved in meticulous detail. He received the Quran, the only scripture to remain unchanged since its revelation. He united the Arabian Peninsula under Islam and laid the foundation for a civilization that would span three continents. His life of 63 years serves as the complete example (Uswah Hasanah) for all Muslims to follow. Sending blessings upon him (Salawat) is commanded in the Quran and is a practice beloved by all Muslims.
